question: I think pineapple on pizza is the best topping choice.
Of course you would think that, you're from Hawaii!
I believe that we should increase funding for public transportation.
Well, you can't even drive a car, so your opinion doesn't count!
I think cats are better pets than dogs.
You just think that because you're allergic to dogs. Your opinion is invalid!
I think we should eat less meat to help the environment.
So, you want us all to starve and become weak from protein deficiency!
I think we should consider renewable energy sources like solar power.
So you're saying we should spend our nights in the dark when the sun isn't shining, huh?
I think we should limit screen time for kids.
Oh, so you want to go back to the Stone Age, with no technology at all?
I think I'll start wearing mismatched socks, it's the latest trend.
What? But my grandma, the ultimate fashion guru, says that's a fashion disaster!
I read somewhere that eating a spoonful of honey before bed can help with sleep.
Are you sure? My gym trainer, who is obviously a sleep expert, says that's nonsense!
I think the earth might actually be flat.
But my favorite basketball player, a renowned astrophysicist, said the earth is round.
I think I'll start drinking coffee to help me stay awake during study sessions.
I think I'll adopt one kitten from the shelter.
Start with one kitten, and soon you'll have two, then three, and before you know it, you'll be the crazy cat person of our neighborhood!
I think I'll skip gym just for today.
Skip today, and soon you'll be skipping tomorrow, then the whole week, and next thing we know, you've turned into a couch potato!
I think that pizza is the best food because it's simply the most delicious food.
But that's just repeating the same thing in different words!
I'm sure that unicorns exist because I've seen real unicorns.
Wait, aren't you just using your conclusion as your premise?
This is the best movie ever because no other movie is as good as this one.
Isn't that like saying it's the best because it's the best?
I met a grumpy New Yorker once. I guess all New Yorkers must be grumpy!
Isn't that a bit of a stretch? Meeting one grumpy New Yorker doesn't mean they're all grumpy.
My first sushi experience was terrible. I'm sure all sushi is disgusting.
Really? You're judging all sushi based on one bad experience?
I saw a poodle being aggressive once. All poodles must be aggressive.
Hold on, one aggressive poodle doesn't mean every poodle is aggressive.
Hey, did you know that you can only be a cat person or a dog person? There's no in-between!
Really? I thought it was possible to love both cats and dogs.
My alien friend told me that on their planet, you either eat pizza for every meal or never eat pizza at all.
That sounds like an extreme choice! What if someone wants pizza just once in a while?
I heard that superheroes can only save the day by flying or having super strength. No other powers allowed!
That doesn't seem right. What about superheroes with other cool abilities, like invisibility or teleportation?
Did you know that every time I wear my lucky socks, it rains outside? My socks must control the weather!
That's just a coincidence! Your socks can't actually cause the rain.
options: Post Hoc Ergo Propter Hoc (correct answer)

question: I ate a banana before my last exam and got an A. Now I believe bananas are the secret to acing tests!
It's great that you did well, but I think your studying might have played a bigger role than the banana.
options: Post Hoc Ergo Propter Hoc (correct answer)

question: Every time I watch a funny cat video, my favorite team wins their game. I must be their lucky charm!
It's fun to think that way, but there's no real connection between you watching cat videos and the team winning.
options: Post Hoc Ergo Propter Hoc (correct answer)

question: Nobody has ever seen a unicorn, so they must not exist!
Just because we haven't seen one doesn't mean they don't exist. There's still so much we don't know about the world!
I've never met anyone who has traveled to the center of the Earth, so it must be impossible.
Just because nobody you know has done it doesn't mean it's impossible. Science is always making new discoveries!
I can't find any information on the internet about aliens building the pyramids, so it must be false.
The absence of evidence isn't proof that something didn't happen. It just means we haven't found any solid proof yet.
Everyone at school is wearing polka dot socks, so they must be the best socks ever!
Just because something is popular doesn't mean it's the best. It's all about personal preference.
I heard that all the top students eat pickles before their exams. I should do that too if I want to succeed!
Following a trend won't guarantee success. Focus on effective study habits instead.
My friends all believe that watching a movie upside down makes it funnier. I should try it too!
That sounds bizarre! Just because your friends think it's funny doesn't mean you will too. It's okay to have your own opinion.
I know that unicorns are magical because every magical creature has a horn, and unicorns have horns!
But you're assuming that having a horn is what makes a creature magical in the first place.
My professor said that her teaching method is the best because it's the most effective way to learn.
That statement assumes that your professor's method is already proven to be effective without any evidence.
Watching a movie upside down must be hilarious because it's a funny way to watch a movie.
You're assuming that it's funny without actually explaining why it would be humorous.
Every time I wear my lucky hat, I find a parking spot right away. My hat must have magical powers!
It's just a coincidence! Your hat isn't causing you to find parking spots.
I started drinking green smoothies every morning, and now my favorite team keeps winning games. My smoothies must be helping them!
Those two events are unrelated. Your smoothies aren't affecting the team's performance.
Whenever it rains, I get a great score on my video game. The rain must be making me a better player!
That's not logical. The rain isn't causing you to play better; it's just a coincidence.
My friend told me I shouldn't eat so much candy, but I saw her eating a whole bag of gummy bears yesterday!
Just because she ate candy too doesn't mean her advice isn't valid.
My professor said that we should always proofread our essays, but I found a typo in their lecture notes!
Everyone makes mistakes, but that doesn't mean the advice to proofread is wrong.
My mom told me not to stay up late playing video games, but I caught her binge-watching her favorite show until 2 am!
She might not be following her own advice, but that doesn't mean it's not good advice for you.
No true dog lover would ever own a cat!
That's not true; people can love both dogs and cats.
A real gamer never plays casual mobile games. They only play hardcore PC or console games!
There are many types of gamers, and enjoying different games doesn't make someone less of a gamer.
You can't be a true pizza fan if you like pineapple on your pizza!
People have different tastes, and liking pineapple on pizza doesn't mean they're not a pizza fan.
